thm lsmcomx(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ Abel ∧ c1 ⊆ c2 ∧ c3 ⊆ c2)→(c1[c4]c3)=(c3[c4]c1))
  ⊣ c2 =(Base ` c0)
  ⊣ c4 =(LSSum ` c0)
} = {
  eqrdv(hs0, (c1[c4]c3), (c3[c4]c1), (c0 ∈ Abel ∧ c1 ⊆ c2 ∧ c3 ⊆ c2))
  3bitr4d((c0 ∈ Abel ∧ c1 ⊆ c2 ∧ c3 ⊆ c2), hs0 ∈(c1[c4]c3), hs0 ∈(c3[c4]c1), ∃(hs1 ∈ c1, ∃(hs2 ∈ c3, hs0 =(hs1[(+ ` c0)]hs2))), ∃(hs2 ∈ c3, ∃(hs1 ∈ c1, hs0 =(hs2[(+ ` c0)]hs1))))
  syl6bb((c0 ∈ Abel ∧ c1 ⊆ c2 ∧ c3 ⊆ c2), ∃(hs1 ∈ c1, ∃(hs2 ∈ c3, hs0 =(hs1[(+ ` c0)]hs2))), ∃(hs2 ∈ c3, ∃(hs1 ∈ c1, hs0 =(hs2[(+ ` c0)]hs1))), ∃(hs1 ∈ c1, ∃(hs2 ∈ c3, hs0 =(hs2[(+ ` c0)]hs1))))
  2rexbidva(hs1, hs2, c1, c3, (c0 ∈ Abel ∧ c1 ⊆ c2 ∧ c3 ⊆ c2), hs0 =(hs1[(+ ` c0)]hs2), hs0 =(hs2[(+ ` c0)]hs1))
  eqeq2d(hs0, (hs1[(+ ` c0)]hs2), (hs2[(+ ` c0)]hs1), ((c0 ∈ Abel ∧ c1 ⊆ c2 ∧ c3 ⊆ c2)∧(hs1 ∈ c1 ∧ hs2 ∈ c3)))
  syl3anc(((c0 ∈ Abel ∧ c1 ⊆ c2 ∧ c3 ⊆ c2)∧(hs1 ∈ c1 ∧ hs2 ∈ c3)), (hs1[(+ ` c0)]hs2)=(hs2[(+ ` c0)]hs1), c0 ∈ Abel, hs1 ∈ c2, hs2 ∈ c2)
  simpl1(c0 ∈ Abel, c1 ⊆ c2, c3 ⊆ c2, (hs1 ∈ c1 ∧ hs2 ∈ c3))
  sseldd(hs1, c2, c1, ((c0 ∈ Abel ∧ c1 ⊆ c2 ∧ c3 ⊆ c2)∧(hs1 ∈ c1 ∧ hs2 ∈ c3)))
  simpl2(c0 ∈ Abel, c1 ⊆ c2, c3 ⊆ c2, (hs1 ∈ c1 ∧ hs2 ∈ c3))
  simprl((c0 ∈ Abel ∧ c1 ⊆ c2 ∧ c3 ⊆ c2), hs1 ∈ c1, hs2 ∈ c3)
  sseldd(hs2, c2, c3, ((c0 ∈ Abel ∧ c1 ⊆ c2 ∧ c3 ⊆ c2)∧(hs1 ∈ c1 ∧ hs2 ∈ c3)))
  simpl3(c0 ∈ Abel, c1 ⊆ c2, c3 ⊆ c2, (hs1 ∈ c1 ∧ hs2 ∈ c3))
  simprr((c0 ∈ Abel ∧ c1 ⊆ c2 ∧ c3 ⊆ c2), hs1 ∈ c1, hs2 ∈ c3)
  ablcom(c0, hs1, c2, hs2, (+ ` c0))
  rexcom(hs1, hs2, c1, c3, hs0 =(hs2[(+ ` c0)]hs1))
  lsmelvalx(hs1, hs2, c0, cabl, c1, c2, c3, hs0, c4, (+ ` c0))
  3com23(c0 ∈ Abel, c1 ⊆ c2, c3 ⊆ c2, (hs0 ∈(c3[c4]c1)↔ ∃(hs2 ∈ c3, ∃(hs1 ∈ c1, hs0 =(hs2[(+ ` c0)]hs1)))))
  lsmelvalx(hs2, hs1, c0, cabl, c3, c2, c1, hs0, c4, (+ ` c0))
  eqid((+ ` c0))
  diff.hs0.c((c1[c4]c3))
  diff.hs0.c((c3[c4]c1))
  diff.hs0.w((c0 ∈ Abel ∧ c1 ⊆ c2 ∧ c3 ⊆ c2))
  diff.hs1.s(hs2)
  diff.hs2.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.w((c0 ∈ Abel ∧ c1 ⊆ c2 ∧ c3 ⊆ c2))
  diff.hs2.w((c0 ∈ Abel ∧ c1 ⊆ c2 ∧ c3 ⊆ c2))
  diff.hs1.c(c3)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.c(c2)
  diff.hs1.c(hs0)
  diff.hs1.c((+ ` c0))
  diff.hs2.c(c0)
  diff.hs2.c(c2)
  diff.hs2.c(c3)
  diff.hs2.c(hs0)
  diff.hs2.c((+ ` c0))
  diff.hs2.s(hs1)
}

blocks.name: ablcntzd
blocks.content: All subgroups in an abelian group commute. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 19-Apr-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm ablcntzd(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wss(c0, cfv(c1, c2)))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(ccntz, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, cabl))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c3)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cfv(csubg, c3)))
} = {
  sseqtr4d(c0, cfv(c1, c2), cfv(cbs, c3), w0)
  syl(w0, wss(c0, cfv(cbs, c3)), wcel(c0, cfv(csubg, c3)))
  subgss(c0, c3, cfv(cbs, c3))
  syl2anc(w0, wceq(cfv(c1, c2), cfv(cbs, c3)), wcel(c3, ccmn), wss(c2, cfv(cbs, c3)))
  syl(w0, wcel(c3, ccmn), wcel(c3, cabl))
  ablcmn(c3)
  syl(w0, wss(c2, cfv(cbs, c3)), wcel(c2, cfv(csubg, c3)))
  subgss(c2, c3, cfv(cbs, c3))
  cntzcmn(c3, c2, cfv(cbs, c3), c1)
  eqid(cfv(cbs, c3))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm ablcntzd(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 → c0 ⊆(c1 ` c2))
  ⊣ c1 =(Cntz ` c3)
  ⊣ (w0 → c3 ∈ Abel)
  ⊣ (w0 → c0 ∈(SubGrp ` c3))
  ⊣ (w0 → c2 ∈(SubGrp ` c3))
} = {
  sseqtr4d(c0, (c1 ` c2), (Base ` c3), w0)
  syl(w0, c0 ⊆(Base ` c3), c0 ∈(SubGrp ` c3))
  subgss(c0, c3, (Base ` c3))
  syl2anc(w0, (c1 ` c2)=(Base ` c3), c3 ∈ CMnd, c2 ⊆(Base ` c3))
  syl(w0, c3 ∈ CMnd, c3 ∈ Abel)
  ablcmn(c3)
  syl(w0, c2 ⊆(Base ` c3), c2 ∈(SubGrp ` c3))
  subgss(c2, c3, (Base ` c3))
  cntzcmn(c3, c2, (Base ` c3), c1)
  eqid((Base ` c3))
}

blocks.name: lsmcom

blocks.name: lsmsubg2
blocks.content: The sum of two subgroups is a subgroup. (Contributed by NM, 4-Feb-2014.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 19-Apr-2016.)

  lsmass(c1, c0, c3, c2, c5)
  syl3anc(w3a(wcel(c0, cabl), wa(wcel(c1, cfv(csubg, c0)), wcel(c2, cfv(csubg, c0))), wa(wcel(c3, cfv(csubg, c0)), wcel(c4, cfv(csubg, c0)))), wceq(co(co(co(c1, c5, c2), c5, c3), c5, c4), co(co(c1, c5, c2), c5, co(c3, c5, c4))), wcel(co(c1, c5, c2), cfv(csubg, c0)), wcel(c3, cfv(csubg, c0)), wcel(c4, cfv(csubg, c0)))

  lsmass(c1, c0, c3, c2, c5)

  syl3anc((c0 ∈ Abel ∧(c1 ∈(SubGrp ` c0)∧ c2 ∈(SubGrp ` c0))∧(c3 ∈(SubGrp ` c0)∧ c4 ∈(SubGrp ` c0))), (c1[c5]c2)∈(SubGrp ` c0), c0 ∈ Abel, c1 ∈(SubGrp ` c0), c2 ∈(SubGrp ` c0))
  lsmsubg2(c0, c1, c2, c5)

  mpteq2dva(hs2, c3, co(cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs2)), cfv(cplusg, cfv(c2, cv(hs2))), cfv(cv(hs1), cv(hs2))), co(cfv(cv(hs1), cv(hs2)), cfv(cplusg, cfv(c2, cv(hs2))), cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs2))), w3a(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, c0)), wcel(cv(hs1), cfv(cbs, c0))))
  syl3anc(wa(w3a(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, c0)), wcel(cv(hs1), cfv(cbs, c0))), wcel(cv(hs2), c3)), wceq(co(cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs2)), cfv(cplusg, cfv(c2, cv(hs2))), cfv(cv(hs1), cv(hs2))), co(cfv(cv(hs1), cv(hs2)), cfv(cplusg, cfv(c2, cv(hs2))), cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs2)))), wcel(cfv(c2, cv(hs2)), ccmn), wcel(cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs2)), cfv(cbs, cfv(c2, cv(hs2)))), wcel(cfv(cv(hs1), cv(hs2)), cfv(cbs, cfv(c2, cv(hs2)))))

  prdsbasprj(cv(hs0), cv(hs2), c2, c0, c1, cfv(cbs, c0), universe, c3, universe, wa(w3a(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, c0)), wcel(cv(hs1), cfv(cbs, c0))), wcel(cv(hs2), c3)))

  adantr(w3a(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, c0)), wcel(cv(hs1), cfv(cbs, c0))), wcel(cv(hs2), c3), wcel(c1, universe))
  adantr(w3a(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, c0)), wcel(cv(hs1), cfv(cbs, c0))), wcel(cv(hs2), c3), wcel(c3, universe))

blocks.name: prdsabld
blocks.content: The product of a family of Abelian groups is an Abelian group. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 10-Jan-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm prdsabld(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(c0, cabl))
  -| wceq(c0, co(c1, cprds, c2))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, c4))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, c5))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c2, c3, cabl))
} = {
  sylanbrc(w0, wcel(c0, cabl), wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c0, ccmn))
  prdsgrpd(c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, c5, w0)
  sylancl(w0, wf(c2, c3, cgrp), wf(c2, c3, cabl), wss(cabl, cgrp))
  ssriv(hs0, cabl, cgrp)
  ablgrp(cv(hs0))
  fss(c2, c3, cabl, cgrp)
  prdscmnd(c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, c5, w0)
  sylancl(w0, wf(c2, c3, ccmn), wf(c2, c3, cabl), wss(cabl, ccmn))
  ssriv(hs0, cabl, ccmn)
  ablcmn(cv(hs0))
  fss(c2, c3, cabl, ccmn)
  isabl(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cabl)
  diff.hs0.c(cgrp)
  diff.hs0.c(ccmn)
}

  syl5bbr((c0 ∈ Abel ∧ c1 ∈(SubGrp ` c0)), ∃(hs3 ∈(Base ` c0), hs1 =[hs3](c0[~QG]c1)), hs1 ∈(Base ` c2), hs1 ∈((Base ` c0)/.(c0[~QG]c1)))

  reeanv(hs2, hs3, (Base ` c0), (Base ` c0), hs0 =[hs2](c0[~QG]c1), hs1 =[hs3](c0[~QG]c1))
  rexlimdvva(hs2, hs3, (Base ` c0), (Base ` c0), (c0 ∈ Abel ∧ c1 ∈(SubGrp ` c0)), (hs0 =[hs2](c0[~QG]c1)∧ hs1 =[hs3](c0[~QG]c1)), (hs0[(+ ` c2)]hs1)=(hs1[(+ ` c2)]hs0))
  syl5ibrcom(((c0 ∈ Abel ∧ c1 ∈(SubGrp ` c0))∧(hs2 ∈(Base ` c0)∧ hs3 ∈(Base ` c0))), (hs0 =[hs2](c0[~QG]c1)∧ hs1 =[hs3](c0[~QG]c1)), (hs0[(+ ` c2)]hs1)=(hs1[(+ ` c2)]hs0), ([hs2](c0[~QG]c1)[(+ ` c2)][hs3](c0[~QG]c1))=([hs3](c0[~QG]c1)[(+ ` c2)][hs2](c0[~QG]c1)))

thm abl1(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cabl))
  -| wceq(c2, cpr(cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), csn(c0)), cop(cfv(cplusg, cnx), csn(cop(cop(c0, c0), c0)))))
} = {
  sylanbrc(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cabl), wcel(c2, cgrp), wral(hs0, csn(c0), wral(hs1, csn(c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), csn(cop(cop(c0, c0), c0)), cv(hs1)), co(cv(hs1), csn(cop(cop(c0, c0), c0)), cv(hs0))))))
  grp1(c0, c1, c2)
  mpbird(wcel(c0, c1), wral(hs0, csn(c0), wral(hs1, csn(c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), csn(cop(cop(c0, c0), c0)), cv(hs1)), co(cv(hs1), csn(cop(cop(c0, c0), c0)), cv(hs0))))), wceq(co(c0, csn(cop(cop(c0, c0), c0)), c0), co(c0, csn(cop(cop(c0, c0), c0)), c0)))
  eqidd(co(c0, csn(cop(cop(c0, c0), c0)), c0), wcel(c0, c1))
  bitrd(wcel(c0, c1), wral(hs0, csn(c0), wral(hs1, csn(c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), csn(cop(cop(c0, c0), c0)), cv(hs1)), co(cv(hs1), csn(cop(cop(c0, c0), c0)), cv(hs0))))), wceq(co(c0, csn(cop(cop(c0, c0), c0)), c0), co(c0, csn(cop(cop(c0, c0), c0)), c0)), wral(hs1, csn(c0), wceq(co(c0, csn(cop(cop(c0, c0), c0)), cv(hs1)), co(cv(hs1), csn(cop(cop(c0, c0), c0)), c0))))
  ralsng(hs0, c0, c1, wral(hs1, csn(c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), csn(cop(cop(c0, c0), c0)), cv(hs1)), co(cv(hs1), csn(cop(cop(c0, c0), c0)), cv(hs0)))), wral(hs1, csn(c0), wceq(co(c0, csn(cop(cop(c0, c0), c0)), cv(hs1)), co(cv(hs1), csn(cop(cop(c0, c0), c0)), c0))))
  ralbidv(hs1, csn(c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), csn(cop(cop(c0, c0), c0)), cv(hs1)), co(cv(hs1), csn(cop(cop(c0, c0), c0)), cv(hs0))), wceq(co(c0, csn(cop(cop(c0, c0), c0)), cv(hs1)), co(cv(hs1), csn(cop(cop(c0, c0), c0)), c0)))
  eqeq12d(co(cv(hs0), csn(cop(cop(c0, c0), c0)), cv(hs1)), co(cv(hs1), csn(cop(cop(c0, c0), c0)), cv(hs0)), co(c0, csn(cop(cop(c0, c0), c0)), cv(hs1)), co(cv(hs1), csn(cop(cop(c0, c0), c0)), c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  oveq1(cv(hs0), c0, csn(cop(cop(c0, c0), c0)), cv(hs1))
  oveq2(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs1), csn(cop(cop(c0, c0), c0)))
  ralsng(hs1, c0, c1, wceq(co(c0, csn(cop(cop(c0, c0), c0)), cv(hs1)), co(cv(hs1), csn(cop(cop(c0, c0), c0)), c0)), wceq(co(c0, csn(cop(cop(c0, c0), c0)), c0), co(c0, csn(cop(cop(c0, c0), c0)), c0)))
  eqeq12d(co(c0, csn(cop(cop(c0, c0), c0)), cv(hs1)), co(cv(hs1), csn(cop(cop(c0, c0), c0)), c0), co(c0, csn(cop(cop(c0, c0), c0)), c0), co(c0, csn(cop(cop(c0, c0), c0)), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c0))
  oveq2(cv(hs1), c0, c0, csn(cop(cop(c0, c0), c0)))
  oveq1(cv(hs1), c0, csn(cop(cop(c0, c0), c0)), c0)
  isabl2(hs0, hs1, c2, csn(c0), csn(cop(cop(c0, c0), c0)))

blocks.name: abln0
blocks.content: Abelian groups (and therefore also groups and monoids) exist. (Contributed by AV, 29-Apr-2019.)

blocks.name: cnaddablx
blocks.content: The complex numbers are an Abelian group under addition. This version of ~ cnaddabl shows the explicit structure "scaffold" we chose for the definition for Abelian groups. Note: This theorem has hard-coded structure indices for demonstration purposes. It is not intended for general use; use ~ cnaddabl instead. (New usage is discouraged.) (Contributed by NM, 18-Oct-2012.)
blocks.origin:
thm cnaddablx(class c0) {
  |- wcel(c0, cabl)
  -| wceq(c0, cpr(cop(nat1, cc), cop(nat2, caddc)))
} = {
  isabli(hs0, hs1, c0, cc, caddc)
  isgrpix(hs0, hs1, hs2, c0, cc, caddc, nat0, cneg(cv(hs0)))
  addcl(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))
  addass(cv(hs0), cv(hs1), cv(hs2))
  0cn()
  addid2(cv(hs0))
  eqtr3d(co(cneg(cv(hs0)), caddc, cv(hs0)), nat0, co(cv(hs0), caddc, cneg(cv(hs0))), wcel(cv(hs0), cc))
  mpdan(wcel(cv(hs0), cc), wceq(co(cv(hs0), caddc, cneg(cv(hs0))), co(cneg(cv(hs0)), caddc, cv(hs0))), wcel(cneg(cv(hs0)), cc))
  negcl(cv(hs0))
  addcom(cv(hs0), cneg(cv(hs0)))
  negid(cv(hs0))
  grpbasex(cc, c0, caddc)
  grpplusgx(caddc, c0, cc)
  cnex()
  addex()
  addcom(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cc)

blocks.name: cnaddabl
blocks.content: The complex numbers are an Abelian group under addition. This version of ~ cnaddablx hides the explicit structure indices i.e. is "scaffold-independent". Note that the proof also does not reference explicit structure indices. The actual structure is dependent on how ` Base ` and ` +g ` is defined. This theorem should not be referenced in any proof. For the group/ring properties of the complex numbers, see ~ cnring . (Contributed by NM, 20-Oct-2012.) (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm cnaddabl(class c0) {
  |- wcel(c0, cabl)
  -| wceq(c0, cpr(cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cc), cop(cfv(cplusg, cnx), caddc)))
} = {

  isgrpi(hs0, hs1, hs2, c0, cc, caddc, nat0, cneg(cv(hs0)))
  addcl(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))
  addass(cv(hs0), cv(hs1), cv(hs2))
  0cn()
  addid2(cv(hs0))
  eqtr3d(co(cneg(cv(hs0)), caddc, cv(hs0)), nat0, co(cv(hs0), caddc, cneg(cv(hs0))), wcel(cv(hs0), cc))
  mpdan(wcel(cv(hs0), cc), wceq(co(cv(hs0), caddc, cneg(cv(hs0))), co(cneg(cv(hs0)), caddc, cv(hs0))), wcel(cneg(cv(hs0)), cc))
  negcl(cv(hs0))
  addcom(cv(hs0), cneg(cv(hs0)))
  negid(cv(hs0))
  ax-mp(wceq(cc, cfv(cbs, c0)), wcel(cc, universe))
  cnex()
  grpbase(cc, universe, c0, caddc)
  ax-mp(wceq(caddc, cfv(cplusg, c0)), wcel(caddc, universe))
  addex()
  grpplusg(caddc, universe, c0, cc)
  addcom(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cc)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(cc)
  diff.hs0.s(hs2)
  diff.hs1.s(hs2)
  diff.hs0.c(caddc)
  diff.hs0.c(nat0)
  diff.hs1.c(caddc)
  diff.hs1.c(nat0)
  diff.hs1.c(cneg(cv(hs0)))
  diff.hs2.c(c0)
  diff.hs2.c(cc)
  diff.hs2.c(caddc)
  diff.hs2.c(nat0)

blocks.name: cnaddid
blocks.content: The group identity element of complex number addition is zero. See also ~ cnfld0 . (Contributed by Steve Rodriguez, 3-Dec-2006.) (Revised by AV, 26-Aug-2021.) (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm cnaddid(class c0) {
  |- wceq(cfv(c0g, c0), nat0)
  -| wceq(c0, cpr(cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cc), cop(cfv(cplusg, cnx), caddc)))
} = {
  eqcomi(cfv(c0g, c0), nat0)
  ax-mp(wceq(nat0, cfv(c0g, c0)), wcel(nat0, cc))
  0cn()
  ismgmid2(hs0, nat0, cfv(c0g, c0), cc, c0, caddc, wcel(nat0, cc))
  ax-mp(wceq(cc, cfv(cbs, c0)), wcel(cc, universe))
  cnex()
  grpbase(cc, universe, c0, caddc)
  eqid(cfv(c0g, c0))
  ax-mp(wceq(caddc, cfv(cplusg, c0)), wcel(caddc, universe))
  addex()
  grpplusg(caddc, universe, c0, cc)
  id(wcel(nat0, cc))
  adantl(wcel(nat0, cc), wcel(cv(hs0), cc), wceq(co(nat0, caddc, cv(hs0)), cv(hs0)))
  addid2(cv(hs0))
  adantl(wcel(nat0, cc), wcel(cv(hs0), cc), wceq(co(cv(hs0), caddc, nat0), cv(hs0)))
  addid1(cv(hs0))
  diff.hs0.c(nat0)
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(c0g, c0))
  diff.hs0.c(cc)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(caddc)
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(nat0, cc))
}

thm cnaddinv(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cc), wceq(cfv(cfv(cminusg, c1), c0), cneg(c0)))

} = {
  mpbird(wcel(c0, cc), wceq(cfv(cfv(cminusg, c1), c0), cneg(c0)), wceq(co(c0, caddc, cneg(c0)), nat0))
  negid(c0)
  mp3an2i(wcel(c0, cc), wb(wceq(cfv(cfv(cminusg, c1), c0), cneg(c0)), wceq(co(c0, caddc, cneg(c0)), nat0)), wcel(c1, cgrp), wcel(c0, cc), wcel(cneg(c0), cc))
  ax-mp(wcel(c1, cgrp), wcel(c1, cabl))
  cnaddabl(c1)
  ablgrp(c1)
  id(wcel(c0, cc))
  negcl(c0)
  grpinvid1(c1, c0, cc, cneg(c0), cfv(cminusg, c1), caddc, nat0)
  ax-mp(wceq(cc, cfv(cbs, c1)), wcel(cc, universe))
  cnex()
  grpbase(cc, universe, c1, caddc)
  ax-mp(wceq(caddc, cfv(cplusg, c1)), wcel(caddc, universe))
  addex()
  grpplusg(caddc, universe, c1, cc)
  eqcomi(nat0, cfv(c0g, c1))
  cnaddid(c1)

}

} = {
  mpbird(c0 ∈ ℂ, ((invg ` c1)` c0)= -u(c0), (c0[+]-u(c0))= 0)
  negid(c0)

  ax-mp(c1 ∈ Grp, c1 ∈ Abel)
  cnaddabl(c1)

blocks.name: frgpnabl
blocks.content: The free group on two or more generators is not abelian. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 21-Apr-2016.)
